prompt: <description>Part 1 Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Sketch Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Face 1 On this face, create a loop consisting of four lines. Line 1 The start point of this line should be at 0.0, 0.0. The end point should be at 0.8542, 0.0. (This creates a horizontal line along the X axis.) Line 2 The start point of this line should be at 0.8542, 0.0. The end point should be at 0.8542, 0.2136. (This creates a vertical line along the Y axis.) Line 3 The start point of this line should be at 0.8542, 0.2136. The end point should be at 0.0, 0.2136. (This creates another horizontal line along the X axis.) Line 4 The start point of this line should be at 0.0, 0.2136. The end point should be at 0.0, 0.0. (This creates a final horizontal line along the X axis, completing the rectangle.) Extrusion Extrude the sketch by 0.0214 units in the positive Z direction, and by 0 in the negative Z direction. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.8542. This will result in a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. Part 2 Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0534, 0.0747, 0.0214. Sketch Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Face 1 On this face, create a loop consisting of one circle. Circle 1 The center of the circle should be at 0.032, 0.032. The radius of the circle should be 0.032. Extrusion Extrude the sketch by 0 units in the positive Z direction, and by 0.4271 units in the negative Z direction. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.0641. This will create a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom, made of a reflective material, standing upright in various views. The dimensions of the final shape are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The curved side has a radius of 0.5 units.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Tapered End Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered end. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0574, 0.0] Now draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Sketch a rectangle consisting of 4 lines: 1. Line 1: Starting point at [0.0, 0.0], ending point at [0.1875, 0.0] 2. Line 2: Starting point at [0.1875, 0.0], ending point at [0.1875, 0.75] 3. Line 3: Starting point at [0.1875, 0.75], ending point at [0.0, 0.75] 4. Line 4: Starting point at [0.0, 0.75], ending point at [0.0, 0.0] Close the loop and complete the sketch. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles and the translation vector provided in the coordinate system. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis with the following parameters: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0469 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.75 Perform a boolean operation to create a new solid body for this part. Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Diagonal Hole Construct a CAD model of a cylindrical object with a smaller cylindrical hole in the center, positioned diagonally from the bottom left to the top right corner of the image. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0284, 0.0105, 0.0394] Now draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Sketch a circle with the following properties: * Center: [0.0653, 0.0653] * Radius: 0.0653 Close the loop and complete the sketch. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles and the translation vector provided in the coordinate system. Sketch another 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Sketch a line with the following properties: * Starting point: [0.0497, 0.7106] * Ending point: [0.081, 0.7106] Followed by an arc, connecting the previously drawn line to create a semi-circle. Close the loop and complete the sketch. Transform the second 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles and the translation vector provided in the coordinate system. Extrude the first sketch along the Z-axis with the following parameters: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0105 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.7106 Extrude the second sketch along the Z-axis with the following parameters: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0105 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.7106 Perform a boolean operation to join the two extruded solids for this part.</description>
